title: Bug 7734 - System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt files, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt files. A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty files. However, currently, when the user left-clicks on the Windows Start menu and selects the "Shut Down..." command to shutdown/reboot the computer, there is no warning or question message box displayed. As a result, the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately without any opportunity to save the dirty files.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down..." command to shutdown/reboot the computer.

Expected results: A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. Other Windows programs, like Word and Outlook, already provide this functionality.
